result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph J Gibbs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: any other sentence
Concurrent with: Counts 2 and 8

miscConds.notes:
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No contact with:  victim/witness/businesses listed in criminal complaint along with those victim/witnesses/businesses and co actor listed in case 22CF655

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Restitution for Waukesha State Bank to be paid as a condition of probation, before costs and fees.

Restitution for Jared Morris in the amount of $13,029.73, joint and several with the co-defendant, to be paid as a condition of probation and to be paid before Waukesha State Bank.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph J Gibbs

records.addlTxt: Not called on the record.  Matter tagged along with case 22CF655.

1:36 PM Defendant Joseph J Gibbs in court.  Attorney Priya Barnes in court for Joseph J Gibbs.  Prosecuting attorney Ted Szczupakiewicz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant. 
Defendant enters a no contest plea to counts 1, 2 and 8. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to Counts 1 2, and 8. 
Court dismisses and reads in Counts 3, 4, 5,6, 7 and Case 22CF655.

Court orders the following:
Count 1
Total Prison: 6 YEARS
Initial Confinement: 3 YEARS
Extended Supervision: 3 YEARS
Concurrent to Counts 2 and 8 and Consecutive to:  any other sentence

STAYED FOR PROBATION
If revoked:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

Term of Probation: 5 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
 Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
 Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
 No contact with:  victim/witness/businesses listed in criminal complaint along with those victim/witnesses/businesses and co actor listed in case 22CF655
 DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

CONDITION TIME: 1 YEAR Waukesha County Jail with Huber, all standard release conditions, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

RESTITUTION:  hearing to be set for case 22CF655, $4859.00 owed to Waukesha State Bank in case 22CF805 (to be paid as a condition of the sentence - restitution to Victim A to be paid before costs or fines);
COSTS:  $ 268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.

Count 2
Total Prison: 6 YEARS
Initial Confinement: 3 YEARS
Extended Supervision: 3 YEARS
Concurrent to Count 1 and 8 and Consecutive to:  any other sentence

STAYED FOR PROBATION
If revoked:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

Term of Probation: 5 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
 Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
 Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
 No contact with:  victim/witness/businesses listed in criminal complaint along with those victim/witnesses/businesses and co actor listed in case 22CF655
 DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

COSTS:  $ 268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.

Count 8
Total Prison: 6 YEARS
Initial Confinement: 3 YEARS
Extended Supervision: 3 YEARS
Concurrent to Count 1 and 2 and Consecutive to:  any other sentence

STAYED FOR PROBATION
If revoked:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

Term of Probation: 5 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
 Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
 Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
 No contact with:  victim/witness/businesses listed in criminal complaint along with those victim/witnesses/businesses and co actor listed in case 22CF655
 DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

COSTS:  $ 268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Court extends any appointment of Atty Barnes to all matters.
Restitution hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Review hearing scheduled for February 19, 2024 at 01:30 pm.
Review hearing on February 19, 2024 at 01:30 pm.
Restitution hearing on October 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Jury status hearing on August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 11, 2022 at 08:15 am.

03:33 PM Defendant Joseph J Gibbs appeared by Zoom with attorney Priya Barnes who appeared by Zoom.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

Attorney Barnes states that the Defendant is on a job site out of county and requests a new plea/sentencing date.
The State does not object.
The Court will set the matter for Jury Trial and a prospective plea/sentencing date.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
dated 08-08-2022, filed by Atty. Priya Barnes requesting a zoom appearance for 08-08-2022
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 8, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

08:46 AM Defendant Joseph J Gibbs in court by zoom with attorney Priya Barnes.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Atty Barnes does request a plea and sentencing date. 
State does not object.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

filed by defendant requesting to appear via zoom for hearing on 07-05-2022

  **Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen on 07-05-2022: Approved to appear by Zoom.**

09:29 AM Defendant Joseph J Gibbs in court with attorney Priya Barnes.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Barnes states her client wishes to waive the preliminary hearing. 
Court conducts colloquy with the defendant. 
Defendant waives his right to preliminary hearing.
  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.
  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.
  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
State files information. 
Defense accepts receipt of the information and waives reading. 
  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant not to use or possess any personal identifying information other than their own, including financial transaction cards, conterfit checks or currency.   Defendant to have no contact with City Wide Insulation/Linda Murphy/Waukesha State Bank listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

10:42 AM Defendant Joseph J Gibbs in court.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney. The Court swears in the Defendant.  The Court extends the appointment of attorney Barnes.
The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defendant as it relates to prelim time limits.
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
